src:
Oproščen tihotapljenja Sircev
Analiza telefonov je pokazala, da obtožena nista komunicirala med seboj.
06 Nov 2019, 18:30 by Oste Bakal



O. B.Mitrovića in Vujinovića (v kratkih hlačah) so na sodišče pripeljali pravosodni policisti. FOTO: Oste Bakal



Mladen Vujinović je krivdo od začetka zanikal. FOTO: Oste Bakal


MURSKA SOBOTA – Na murskosoboškem okrožnem sodišču se je pred sodnico Natalijo Goldinskij Husar končal kazenski postopek zoper dva Srba iz Sremske Mitrovice zaradi tihotapljenja ljudi čez državno mejo. Goran Mitrović je takoj priznal krivdo in bil obsojen, ker je 19. junija iz Hrvaške v Slovenijo pretihotapil pet državljanov Sirije, nezakonitih migrantov, ki so želeli v zahodno Evropo. Za prevoz je od vsakega prejel najmanj 100 evrov, je priznal 42-letnik, ki je bil obsojen na sedem mesecev zapora in 1112 evrov denarne kazni. Njegov 31-letni rojak Mladen Vujinović, ki krivde ni priznal, pa je po treh mesecih in pol odkorakal iz murskosoboškega pripora, saj je bil na glavni obravnavi oproščen očitkov. Če bo sodba postala pravnomočna, mu bomo slovenski davkoplačevalci poleg stroškov postopka in zagovornika najbrž morali poravnati še odškodnino za neupravičeno bivanje v priporu.
Odvetnik o utrujenih policistih
Dvojico so 19. junija letos prijeli v okolici Ljutomera, a naj ne bi bila povezana. Da je to res, je dejal tudi obsojeni Mitrović, ki je na glavni obravnavi dejal, da soobtoženega ne pozna in ga je prvič videl na sodišču v Murski Soboti. Vujinović je v svoj bran povedal, da se je junija res gibal po Sloveniji, tudi v okolici Ljutomera, a le zato, da se pripelje do Avstrije, kjer je iskal službo.»Policistom nič ne zamerim. Morda so utrujeni zaradi obilice dela in so preprosto povezali v eno kaznivo dejanje dva tujca v dveh avtomobilih z istimi krajevnimi registrskimi oznakami,« je v zaključnem govoru na glavni obravnavi dejal zagovornik Milan Krstić in še nekoliko pikro dodal: »Strah me je, v kakšni državi živimo. Pričakoval bi, da bi tožilstvo z umikom obtožnice proti mojemu varovancu samo končalo zadevo, ne pa da smo zdaj imeli sojenje. Analiza telefonov je že v preiskavi pokazala, da nista komunicirala med seboj. Vujinović ni prejel nobenega plačila ali denarja, da je sodeloval v kaznivem dejanju. Vemo pa, kako se opravljajo plačila za kazniva dejanja tihotapljenja ljudi.«


Mladen Vujinović je krivdo od začetka zanikal. FOTO: Oste Bakal

Da obstaja upravičen dvom, da je bil vpleten, se je strinjala tudi sodnica, ki meni, da morda obstajajo indici, da je zaradi izvrševanja kaznivega dejanja res prišel v Slovenijo. »Ampak na tak način, kot ste bili obtoženi in da ste v dejanju sodelovali z vašim že obsojenim rojakom, pa v tej zadevi ni dovolj dokazov,« je dejala. Vujinović naj bi po izreku oprostilne sodbe še isti dan odšel domov, denar za potovanje naj bi mu posodil kar odvetnik Krstić.Nezadovoljen s takšno sodbo je okrožni državni tožilec Borut Horvat takoj napovedal pritožbo na višje sodišče v Mariboru.
text:
Exempt from smuggling Syrians
An analysis of the phones showed that the accused did not communicate with each other.
06 Nov 2019, 18:30 by Oste Bakal



O. B. Mitrovic and Vujinovic (shorts) were brought to court by judicial police officers. PHOTO: Oste Bakal



Mladen Vujinovic has denied the blame from the beginning. PHOTO: Oste Bakal


MURSKA SOBOTA - Criminal proceedings against two Serbs from Sremska Mitrovica have ended in Murska Sobota County Court before Judge Natalija Goldinsky Husar for smuggling people across the state border. Goran Mitrovic immediately pleaded guilty and was convicted of smuggling five Syrian nationals, irregular migrants, who wanted to Western Europe from Croatia to Slovenia on June 19th. He received at least $ 100 from each for transportation, admitted the 42-year-old, who was sentenced to seven months in prison and a $ 1,112 fine. His 31-year-old countryman, Mladen Vujinovic, who pleaded not guilty, stepped down from Murska Sobota detention after three and a half months, as he was acquitted at the main hearing. If the verdict becomes final, Slovenian taxpayers will probably have to pay him compensation for his unjustified detention in addition to the costs of the proceedings and his lawyer.
Attorney on tired police officers
The pair were arrested on 19 June this year in the vicinity of Ljutomer, but are unrelated. The convicted Mitrovic also said that this was true, who said at the trial that he did not know the co-accused and first saw him at the Murska Sobota court. Vujinovic said in his defense that in June he was indeed moving around Slovenia, including in the vicinity of Ljutomer, but only to get to Austria, where he was looking for a job. They may be tired of the abundance of work and have simply linked two strangers in two cars with the same local registration plates into one crime, "defense attorney Milan Krstic said in a closing speech at the main hearing, adding," I'm terrified we live in the country. I would expect that with the withdrawal of the indictment against my client, the prosecution would only end the case, not that we now have a trial. An analysis of the phones already revealed in the investigation that they did not communicate with each other. Vujinovic received no payment or money for his involvement in the crime. But we know how payments are made for the smuggling of people. "


Mladen Vujinovic has denied the blame from the beginning. PHOTO: Oste Bakal

The judge also agreed that there was reasonable doubt that he had been involved, who said that there may be indications that he had indeed come to Slovenia to commit the crime. "But in the way you were accused and involved in the act with your already convicted compatriot, there is not enough evidence in this case," she said. Vujinovic is expected to go home the same day after the acquittal, the lawyer Krstic would lend him the money. Dissatisfied with such a ruling, District Attorney Borut Horvat immediately announced his appeal to the Maribor High Court.
